It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and aquariums due to its attractive foliage and floral display. Ludwigia spathulifolia is also valued for its ability to help purify water and provide habitat for aquatic life.
